alert.note: Alert for Camden; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 12:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, and northwestern Currituck Counties, the City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 130 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of South Mills, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Ocean View, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Great Bridge, South Mills, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Fentress, Cradock, Princess Anne, Back Bay, Norfolk International and Ghent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
